content.question: A particle moves along the x-axis so that at any time <math> <mrow> <mi>t</mi> <mo>></mo> <mn>0</mn> </mrow> </math>, its velocity is given by <math> <mrow> <mi>v</mi> <mrow> <mo>(</mo> <mi>t</mi> <mo>)</mo> </mrow> <mo>=</mo> <mn>4</mn> <mo>−</mo> <mn>6</mn> <msup> <mi>t</mi> <mn>2</mn> </msup> </mrow> </math>. If the particle is at position <math> <mrow> <mi>x</mi><mo>=</mo><mn>7</mn></mrow> </math> at <math> <mrow> <mi>t</mi> <mo>=</mo> <mn>1</mn> </mrow> </math> time, what is the position of the particle at time <math> <mrow> <mi>t</mi><mo>=</mo><mn>2</mn></mrow> </math>?

topic.text: 7.7: Finding Particular Solutions Using Initial Conditions and Separation of Variables

skill.text: Skill 1.D: Identify an appropriate mathematical rule or procedure based on the relationship between concepts (e.g., rate of change and accumulation) or processes (e.g., differentiation and its inverse process, anti-differentiation) to solve problems.
